H0.text: Population is the factor regulated by predation in the case of the moose.

H1.text: Speed is the factor regulated by predation in the case of the moose.

H2.text: Color is the factor that predation regulates in the case of the moose.

H3.text: Weight is the factor that predation regulates in the case of the moose.

A4.text: the more aggressive individuals are always darker in color, with the darkest coloring usually in areas facing the opponent, thus serving as a natural warning to other animals

A5.text: Moose are more vulnerable in areas where wolf or bear populations were decimated in the past but are now rebounding
